meanings.definition: Relating to a tribe or tribes.
meanings.sent1: The tribal chief led his people with wisdom and strength.
meanings.sent2: The tribal dance celebrated their shared history and culture.
meanings.sent3: The tribal elders had a meeting under the ancient tree.
meanings.sent4: The tribal bond between the members was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The tribal markings on their faces symbolized unity and belonging.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or associated with a tribe.
meanings.sent1: The tribal language was spoken by all the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The tribal clothing was colorful and intricate.
meanings.sent3: The tribal feast was a delicious gathering of friends.
meanings.sent4: The tribal customs were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The tribal music echoed through the valley, filling the air with joy.

meanings.definition: A group of people united by ties of descent from a common ancestor, community of customs and traditions, adherence to the same leaders, etc.
meanings.sent1: The tribal gathered around the fire to share stories.
meanings.sent2: The tribal elected a new leader to guide them.
meanings.sent3: The tribal competed in a friendly game of soccer.
meanings.sent4: The tribal welcomed a newcomer with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The tribal worked together to build a new community center.
